title: Benchmarking Automated Clinical Language Simplification: Dataset, Algorithm, and Evaluation. (arXiv:2012.02420v2 [cs.CL] UPDATED)
abstract: Patients with low health literacy usually have difficulty understanding medical jargon and the complex structure of professional medical language. Although some studies are proposed to automatically translate expert language into layperson-understandable language, only a few of them focus on both accuracy and readability aspects simultaneously in the clinical domain. Thus, simplification of the clinical language is still a challenging task, but unfortunately, it is not yet fully addressed in previous work. To benchmark this task, we construct a new dataset named MedLane to support the development and evaluation of automated clinical language simplification approaches. Besides, we propose a new model called DECLARE that follows the human annotation procedure and achieves state-of-the-art performance compared with eight strong baselines. translated_title: 评估自动临床语言简化的基准：数据集、算法和评估
translated_abstract: 低健康素养的患者通常很难理解医学术语和专业医学语言的复杂结构。尽管有一些研究提出了自动将专业语言翻译成普通人可以理解的语言，但其中只有少数关注了临床领域中准确性和可读性的两个方面。因此，临床语言的简化仍然是一个具有挑战性的任务，但可惜的是，在之前的工作中尚未完全解决。为了评估这项任务，我们构建了一个名为MedLane的新数据集，以支持自动临床语言简化方法的开发和评估。此外，我们提出了一种名为DECLARE的新模型，遵循人工注释过程，与八种强基准模型相比取得了最先进的性能。为了公平评估性能，我们还提出了三个特定的评估指标。实验结果表明了MedLane数据集的实用性。
tldr: 该论文构建了一个名为MedLane的新数据集，支持自动临床语言简化方法的开发和评估。提出了一种叫做DECLARE的新模型，与八种基准模型相比取得了最先进的性能，并提出了三个特定的评估指标。
en_tdlr: This paper presents MedLane, a new dataset for supporting the development and evaluation of automated clinical language simplification approaches. It introduces a new model called DECLARE, which achieves state-of-the-art performance compared to eight strong baselines, and proposes three specific evaluation metrics.
